docs.title: üßæ How to Use the Rivine QR Code Generator
docs.intro: Generate a QR code in seconds! Whether you're linking to a website, sharing a quick note, or embedding a phone number ‚Äî it's all just a few clicks away.

whatIs.title: ‚ú® What is a QR Code?
whatIs.description: A QR (Quick Response) code is a type of barcode that holds information like links, text, or contact details. It can be scanned using your phone camera or a QR code scanner to instantly access the content.

url.title: URL:
url.description: Link to websites, portfolios, or apps.

phone.title: Phone:
phone.description: Embed a number so users can tap and call.

steps.title: üöÄ How to Generate a QR Code

step1.title: Step 1: Pick What You Want to Encode
step1.description: Use the menu on the left to select URL, Text, or Phone.

step2.title: Step 2: Type Your Content
step2.description: Enter your content in the input field. The QR code updates instantly!

step3.title: Step 3: Preview Your QR Code
step3.description: You'll see the code appear to the right ‚Äî ready to scan.

step4.title: Step 4: Choose the File Format
step4.description: Pick PNG or SVG depending on how you‚Äôll use it.

step5.title: Step 5: Download
step5.description: Click the button and you're done!

tips.title: üí° Pro Tips
tips.tip1: For printing, use SVG to avoid blurry edges.
tips.tip2: Leave some white space around the QR code for better scanning.
tips.tip3: Make sure your content is accurate before sharing.
tips.tip4: Test with your phone camera before publishing it anywhere.

qrNotShowing.title: QR Code not showing?
qrNotShowing.description: Double-check that you‚Äôve typed something valid and selected the right tab.

downloadNotWorking.title: Download not working?
downloadNotWorking.description: Try another format or refresh the page.
